basic_info.name: Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences Courses & Fees
description: Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers MBBS at the undergraduate level and MD/MS courses at the postgraduate level. Here are the complete details of Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences Courses & fees.

basic_info.name: Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences Admission 2024
description: The admission procedure at Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences is conducted in online mode. Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers admission to the MBBS program on the basis of the candidate’s performance in NEET UG. Admission to MD/MS programs is based on NEET PG scores. After qualifying for the respective examinations, the candidates need to register for the All India and State Counselling Process conducted by MCC and Dr YSR Univeristy of Health Sciences, Andhra Pradesh respectively. Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers admission to 15% of MBBS and 50% of MD/MS seats through the All-India Quota. The candidates can also be admitted through State Quota in 85% of MBBS and 50% of MD/MS seats in Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences.

faqs.question: What is the intake capacity for the MBBS course offered at Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.The student intake capacity for the MBBS course is 100 students per year at Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences.

faqs.question: What are the specializations available in the courses offered by the Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers specializations in the MD and MS courses. Some of the specializations include Pediatrics, General Surgery, Dermatology, General Medicine, Obstetrics and gynecology, and others.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for undergraduate and postgraduate courses at Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers admission to students based on merit in NEET examinations. Admission to MBBS is based on NEET UG scores whereas to take admission in the MD/MS courses at Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences, the applicant has to qualify for the NEET PG examination.

faqs.question: Which courses are available at Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers three courses in the field of medical science. The institute offers MBBS and MD/MS at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels respectively.

faqs.question: Which university does Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences is affiliated with?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences is affiliated with NTR University of Health Sciences.

faqs.question: When was the Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences established?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences was established in the year 2010 in Kapada, Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: What facilities are available at the Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers a great campus life for its students. It has a campus area of 36.52 acres. The institute has computer labs, a library, well-equipped classrooms and other facilities.

faqs.question: How many departments are there at the Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences has five departments as follows, Anatomy, Physiology, Biochemistry, Paraclinical and Clinical departments.

faqs.question: What documents are required for admission to Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.The following documents are required to be admitted to the Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences.NEET 2024 Admit Card10+2 Qualifying Examination Pass Certificate and Mark SheetReceipt of Payment of FeesAllotment LetterProof of Date of BirthPhysical Fitness CertificateTransfer Certificate from the last attended institutesMigration Certificate (if applicable)MBBS Degree issued by Concerned University (For MD/MS)Graduation Marksheet and Certificates (For MD/MS)Internship Certificate (For MD/MS)MCI Registration Certificate (For MD/MS)

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for the MS course at Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences?
faqs.answer: Ans.Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers admission to 3 students in Obstetrics & Gynecology and 4 students in General Surgery domain.

Section.name: About FIMS Kadapa
Section.description:
Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences was established in Kadapa, Andhra Pradesh in the year 2007 by the Mohammadiya Educational Society. Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences is affiliated with NTR University of Health Sciences. The institute is approved by the Medical Council of India (MCI). Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers MBBS, MD, and MS under different specializations.
Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers admission to 100 students in the MBBS course. The institute has five departments in the field of medical science. The institute has received Muslim Minority Status from the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Andhra Pradesh.
Table of Content

After qualifying for the respective examinations, the candidates need to register for the All India and State Counselling Process conducted by MCC and Dr YSR Univeristy of Health Sciences, Andhra Pradesh respectively. Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences offers admission to 15% of MBBS and 50% of MD/MS seats through the All-India Quota. The candidates can also be admitted through State Quota in 85% of MBBS and 50% of MD/MS seats in Fathima Institute of Medical Sciences.
